page.title: 01HIGH HAM & SURROUNDING AREA
page.content: The village of High Ham is 100m. above sea-level on a hill rising sharply from the moors below. The hamlets of Beer, Aller, Low Ham & Henley cluster round the foot of the hill. This is an agricultural area, mainly dairy farming with some cereals and other crops grown. The majority of the some 600 inhabitants work outside the area. A few run businesses from their homes e.g. computer companies and crafts. High Ham has a thriving Primary School which provides many after-school clubs for the children. Many community clubs are run from the village hall: Women's Institute, Over 60's, Playgroup, Youth Club. High Ham has a private secondary school. Many visitors come to this unspoilt area with its buildings of blue lias stone, its panoramic views over surrounding countryside, plus the only thatched windmill in the country.
